subject: Data
title: Structured vs. Unstructured Data
description: A micro-lesson that makes Structured vs. Unstructured Data usable.

hook.text: A spreadsheet and a handwritten diary both contain information. But a computer can read only one of them easily.

buildup.text: Structured data fits neatly into rows and columns â€” names, dates, prices. Databases love it.

discovery.text: Unstructured data â€” emails, videos, social posts â€” makes up about 80% of all data created.

twist.text: AI is changing this: natural language processing can now extract structure from unstructured text.

climax.text: Understanding this distinction explains why some data is easy to analyze and some requires expensive tools.

punchline.text: Most of the world's data doesn't fit in a spreadsheet.
